head.title: In Palm Springs, a Classic Hotel Tries to Recapture Its Swagger

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Hospitality, Restaurant and Travel

hedline.hl1: In Palm Springs, a Classic Hotel Tries to Recapture Its Swagger

block.p: The Colony Palms Hotel in Palm Springs, Calif., reopens next month after a $15 million makeover by Martyn Lawrence-Bullard, a British-born, California-based interior designer. The 56-room hotel, which was once a brothel and speakeasy, and later a hotel run by Robert Howard, a son of the owner of the racehorse Seabiscuit, has been redone in a 1940s Mediterranean style with Moorish elements. The new rooms have seven-foot headboards covered in tribal rugs woven in Uzbekistan, vintage photography and Eames-inspired stools (Mr. Lawrence-Bullard's sole concession to Palm Springs's legendary midcentury modernism). Colony Palms Hotel, 572 North Indian Canyon Drive, Palm Springs, Calif., (800) 557-2187, colonypalmshotel.com.
